column4: hi would like to know how to preserve timestamps when moving a folder  ? using ubuntu 10.10
mv command renames the file or change the file
no it does not do that
it only renames or changes the file in terminal
: I wanted to transfer a folder of photo but when I ctrl+x the folder to other directory , the original timestamps was modified into the current date of transfer (now)
: cp is only copy the file/folder  but what about transfer a the file/folder ? mv is the command ?
: Sorry for my newbie on ubuntu , take you time :)
sudo cp -R file full path is the command
